title: Fun in the Water
subtle: Concept (nonfiction), 40 words, Level A (Grade K), Lexile BR80L
description: When the heat rises, there are few things more inviting than taking a dip in cool and refreshing water. In Fun in the Water, students will read about several delightful water activities. Early emergent readers will use the repetitive sentence pattern to help in decoding the text and will also learn about main idea and details and complete sentences.
reviewWords: dive, fish, float, paddle, play, sail, splash, swim, water
comprehension: Main Idea and Details                : Identify main idea and details
awareness: Initial Sound                : Discriminate initial consonant /s/ sound
phonics: Consonants : Identify initial and final consonant Ss
grammar: Complete Sentences                : Recognize and use complete sentences
wordWork: Concept Words                : Identify and use position words
